channel.title: Newb question re: nmap etc
channel.description:
Hi all,
I'm new to whonix, but familiar with tor, tails.
I spend an hour or so reading the docs and forums but I'm still unclear about how tools that aren't pre-installed / documented (e.g. nmap) behave;
- is there any chance of ip leakage etc if I just install tools like nmap and ftp (on the workstation) and start running them? I'm guessing not based on https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Protocol-Leak-Protection_and_Fingerprinting-Protection but I just wanted check!
- should I be trying to torify and uwt (stream isolation) them anyway, even if I'm protected by the gateway?
Thanks!

item.title: Newb question re: nmap etc
item.dc:creator: r00ted_calculator
item.description:
Hi all,

I’m new to whonix, but familiar with tor, tails.

I spend an hour or so reading the docs and forums but I’m still unclear about how tools that aren’t pre-installed / documented (e.g. nmap) behave;

  • is there any chance of ip leakage etc if I just install tools like nmap and ftp (on the workstation) and start running them? I’m guessing not based on https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Protocol-Leak-Protection_and_Fingerprinting-Protection but I just wanted check!

  • should I be trying to torify and uwt (stream isolation) them anyway, even if I’m protected by the gateway?

Thanks!
